result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas M. Schurk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas M. Schurk is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas M. Schurk was found guilty of Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: No DNA & surcharge as offense was prior to new law effective date
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas M. Schurk

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas M. Schurk in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that an offer was provided by mail to the defendant.  After discussing the matter with the defendant before court, the parties do have resolution.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 2.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed.
Defendant agrees.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
Defendant enters a guilty plea.
Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 2.  Ct. 1 to be dismissed.  

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 2:  Pay fine and costs = $442.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 surcharge
60 days to pay
Ct. 1 to be dismissed.

Pre-trial conference at 09-08-2015 09:45 am.
Return date at 10-08-2015 03:30 pm.

Defendant Thomas M. Schurk in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    
  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
Defendant has no objection.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  
Court finds probable cause.
  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and Pre-Trial.  Return date scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 09:45 am.
letter from Atty Hendee stating that the defendant requested a reset on his IA scheduled for June 22nd; ok'd reset to August 10th.
copy of letter D.A. sent defendant regarding Court date
